009package imagingbook.common.hough.lines;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.awt.Shape;
014import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
015import java.util.Locale;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.HessianLine;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.shape.ShapeProducer;
021
022/**
023 * This class represents a straight line of the form
024 * (x - xRef) * cos(angle) + (y - yRef) * sin(angle) = radius.
025 * It is used by the Hough transform (see {@link imagingbook.common.hough.HoughTransformLines}).
026 * It inherits from {@link HessianLine} which is, in turn, a subclass of 
027 * {@link AlgebraicLine}.
028 * It adds an arbitrary reference point (xRef, yRef) and a counter (count) for pixel votes.
029 * Instances are immutable.
030 */
031public class HoughLine extends HessianLine implements Comparable<HoughLine>, ShapeProducer {
032        
033        private final double xRef, yRef;        // reference point
034        private final int count;                        // pixel votes for this line
035        
036        // static factory methods -------------------------------
037        
038        public static HoughLine fromPoints(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2, Pnt2d pRef, int count) {
039                return new HoughLine(AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2), pRef.getX(), pRef.getY(), count);
040        }
041        
042        // constructors -----------------------------------------
043
044        /**
045         * Constructor. Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from the
046         * specified {@link HessianLine} parameters (angle, radius),
047         * an arbitrary reference point (xRef, yRef) and count.
048         * 
049         * @param angle the line's normal angle (see {@link HessianLine})
050         * @param radius the line's radius (distance to reference point)
051         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
052         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
053         * @param count pixel votes for this line
054         */
055        public HoughLine(double angle, double radius, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
056                super(angle, radius);
057                this.xRef = xRef;
058                this.yRef = yRef;
059                this.count = count;
060        }
061        
062        /**
063         * Constructor. 
064         * Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from a given
065         * {@link AlgebraicLine} (or any subclass) instance.
066         * The line parameters are adjusted to the specified reference point
067         * (actually only parameter c is modified, since a change of reference point
068         * effects only a shift of the line).
069         * The two lines are equivalent, i.e., contain the same points (x,y).
070         * Thus the distance from a given point (x,y) is the same from the original
071         * line and the new line.
072         * @param line an existing line ({@link AlgebraicLine} or subclass)
073         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
074         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
075         * @param count pixel votes for this line
076         */
077        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine line, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
078                super(new AlgebraicLine(line.A, line.B, line.C + line.A * (xRef - line.getXref()) + line.B * (yRef - line.getYref())));
079                this.xRef = xRef;
080                this.yRef = yRef;
081                this.count = count;
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Convenience constructor. Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from a given
086         * {@link AlgebraicLine} (or any subclass) instance with the same reference point 
087         * as the original line and zero count.
088         * 
089         * @param line a {@link AlgebraicLine} instance
090         */
091        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine line) {
092                this(line, line.getXref(), line.getYref(), 0);
093        }
094        
095        // ------------------------------------------
096        
097        @Override
098        public double getXref() {
099                return xRef;
100        }
101        
102        @Override
103        public double getYref() {
104                return yRef;
105        }
106        
107        public int getCount() {
108                return count;
109        }
110        
111        // other methods ------------------------------------------
112        
113        /**
114         * Required by the {@link Comparable} interface, used for sorting lines by their
115         * point count (in descending order, i.e., strong lines come first).
116         * @param other another {@link HoughLine} instance.
117         */
118        @Override
119        public int compareTo(HoughLine other) {
120                return Integer.compare(other.count, this.count);
121        }
122        
123        @Override
124        public String toString() {
125                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <angle = %.3f, radius = %.3f, xRef = %.3f, yRef = %.3f, count = %d>",
126                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getAngle(), getRadius(), getXref(), getYref(), count);
127        }
128        
129        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
130        
131//      @Override
132//      public Shape getShape(int width, int height) {
133//              double length = Math.sqrt(sqr(width) + sqr(height));
134//              return this.getShape(length);
135//      }
136//
137//      @Override
138//      public Shape getShape(double length) {
139//              double xRef = this.getXref();
140//              double yRef = this.getYref();
141//              double angle = this.getAngle();
142//              double radius = this.getRadius();
143//              // unit vector perpendicular to the line
144//              double dx = Math.cos(angle);    
145//              double dy = Math.sin(angle);
146//              // calculate the line's center point (closest to the reference point)
147//              double x0 = xRef + radius * dx;
148//              double y0 = yRef + radius * dy;
149//              // calculate the line end points (using normal vectors)
150//              double x1 = x0 + dy * length;
151//              double y1 = y0 - dx * length;
152//              double x2 = x0 - dy * length;
153//              double y2 = y0 + dx * length;
154//              Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
155//              path.moveTo(x1, y1);
156//              path.lineTo(x2, y2);
157//              return path;
158//      }
159
160}
